meanings.definition: A bond, deed, or other document kept in the custody of a third party, taking effect only when a specified condition has been fulfilled.
meanings.sent1: The escrow contained the important legal papers for the house sale.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent held the escrow until the buyer's loan was approved.
meanings.sent3: The escrow felt like a secret treasure chest waiting to be unlocked.
meanings.sent4: The escrow was a time capsule of legal agreements frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The escrow was like a vault protecting the valuable documents inside.

meanings.definition: Money or property held by a third party on behalf of others until a transaction is completed.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer safeguarded the escrow funds until the business deal was finalized.
meanings.sent2: The escrow account ensured that the payment was secure during the transaction.
meanings.sent3: The escrow seemed like a responsible babysitter for the money until it found a new home.
meanings.sent4: The escrow was a safety net, catching the money until the deal was done.
meanings.sent5: The escrow functioned as a trustworthy guardian of the funds until the transfer was complete.
